atypic package

Submodules

atypic.effects module

class atypic.effects.ColorChannelSplitEffect(frame, split_distance=0.1, which='row', order='bgr', **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a color channel split effect to an image frame. This effect shifts each color channel (B, G, R) by a specified distance.

apply()[source]

Apply the color channel split effect to the frame.

class atypic.effects.ColorPaletteReductionEffect(frame, num_colors=4, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a color palette reduction effect to an image frame. This effect reduces the number of colors in the frame to a specified number.

apply()[source]

Apply the color palette reduction effect to the frame. This method quantizes each color channel to the specified number of colors.

class atypic.effects.ColorValueEffect(frame, shift_value=50, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a color value shift effect to an image frame. This effect shifts the color values of the frame by a specified amount.

apply()[source]

Apply the color shift effect to the frame.

class atypic.effects.CorruptionEffect(frame, corruption_type='random', bitsize=0.01, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a corruption effect to an image frame. This effect randomly corrupts blocks of pixels in the frame.

apply()[source]

Apply the corruption effect to the frame.

class atypic.effects.Effect(frame, mask=None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for image/video effects.

apply_mask()[source]

Ensure the effect is only visible where mask == 255, if subclass does not consider mask upon creation

class atypic.effects.RandomRollPixelsEffect(frame, which='row', group_size=0.2, shift_range=(0.1, 0.1), **kwargs)[source]

Bases: RollPixelsEffect

Apply a random pixel roll effect to an image frame. This effect randomly shifts blocks of pixels in either rows or columns.

apply()[source]

Apply the random pixel roll effect to the frame.

class atypic.effects.RollPixelsEffect(frame, which='row', shift_length=0.1, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a pixel roll effect to an image frame.

apply()[source]

Apply the pixel roll effect to the frame. which: ‘row’ or ‘col’ (default uses self.which)

class atypic.effects.SortEffect(frame, which='row', sort_by='value', reverse=False, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Effect

Apply a sorting effect to an image frame. This effect sorts pixels in a specified direction (row or column) based on their color values.

apply()[source]

Apply the sorting effect to the frame.

atypic.mask module

class atypic.mask.Masker(frame, region=None, shape=None, behavior='or')[source]

Bases: object

A class to create and manage masks for video frames. It allows for the creation of various shapes and patterns as masks, which can be applied to video frames. The masks can be combined using different behaviors such as ‘or’, ‘and’, ‘xor’, ‘nand’, and ‘nor’.

create_band_mask(orientation='horizontal', start=0, end=None, behavior=None)[source]

Create a horizontal or vertical band mask. Args: orientation (str): ‘horizontal’ or ‘vertical’ start (int | float): Starting index of the band end (int | float, optional): Ending index of the band (defaults to frame edge) behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_checkerboard_mask(block_size=10, behavior=None)[source]

Create a checkerboard pattern mask. Args: block_size (int | float): Size of each square block behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_circle_mask(center, radius, behavior=None)[source]

Create a circular mask. Args: center (tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]): (x, y) coordinates of the circle center radius (int | float): Radius of the circle behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_ellipse_mask(center, axes, angle=0, behavior=None)[source]

Create an elliptical mask. Args: center (tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]): (x, y) coordinates of the ellipse center axes (tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]): (major_axis_length, minor_axis_length) angle (float, optional): Rotation angle of the ellipse in degrees behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_full_mask(behavior=None)[source]

Create a mask that covers the entire frame. Args: behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_polygon_mask(points, behavior=None)[source]

Create a polygonal mask. Args: points (list[tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]]): List of (x, y) coordinates defining the polygon vertices behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_rectangle_mask(top_left, bottom_right, behavior=None)[source]

Create a rectangular mask. Args: top_left (tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]): (x, y) coordinates of the top-left corner bottom_right (tuple[int, int] | tuple[float, float]): (x, y) coordinates of the bottom-right corner behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

create_stripe_mask(orientation='horizontal', stripe_width=10, gap=10, behavior=None)[source]

Create a striped mask. Args: orientation (str): ‘horizontal’ or ‘vertical’ stripe_width (int | float): Width of each stripe gap (int | float): Gap between stripes behavior (str, optional): Mask combination behavior

class atypic.mask.SubMasker(mask)[source]

Bases: object

A class to represent an individual mask element. This is used to create and manage individual masks generated in the Masker class.

Module contents

atypic: Add atypical artifacts to image frames.
